arm_group.arm_group_label: Brief Alcohol Intervention plus Standard Batterer intervention
arm_group.description: Brief Alcohol Intervention plus 40 hours of Standard Batterer intervention

arm_group.arm_group_label: General Health Improvement plus Standard batterer intervention
arm_group.description: General Health Improvement Intervention plus 40 hours of Standard Batterer intervention

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators hypothesize that individuals receiving the brief substance use
      intervention will have better substance use and intimate partner violence outcomes than
      individuals receiving the general health improvement intervention. All participants receive
      standard batterer intervention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Participation in Batterer Intervention Program in RI

          -  Hazardous Drinking

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  drinks too much

intervention.arm_group_label: Brief Alcohol Intervention plus Standard Batterer intervention
intervention.description: Brief Alcohol Intervention plus 40 hours or Standard Batterer Intervention
intervention.intervention_name: Brief Alcohol Intervention plus Standard Batterer Intervention

intervention.arm_group_label: General Health Improvement plus Standard batterer intervention
intervention.description: General Health Improvement Intervention plus 40 hours of Standard Batterer Intervention
intervention.intervention_name: General Health Improvement Intervention plus Standard Batterer Intervention

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Brief Substance Use Intervention on Substance Use and Intimate Partner Violence

primary_outcome.description: lower levels of any violence and severe intimate partner violence (psychological, physical, sexual, injuries)
primary_outcome.measure: lower levels of intimate partner violence

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: lower levels of substance use (alcohol and drug)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
